DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Outcome Surgical Therapy CAHPS Cancer Care Survey Assessment Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._The result of an action._A response that a surgical procedure was the curative therapy._A standardized instrument designed to assess the experiences of adult patients with cancer treatment provided in outpatient and inpatient settings. The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery._a free text field to specify information on the evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease

The survey consists of three parallel instruments specific for either radiation therapy, chemotherapy, or cancer surgery.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
